**Omschrijving van het probleem:** 
URL van het verwacht type 'Rechtsgrond (Besluit)' is niet correct: 'ttp' i.p.v. 'http'

**Omschrijving van een mogelijke oplossing:**
Correcte URL is http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#LegalResource

items.title: zie_ook in Vlaamse codex
items.body:
Als ik kijk in de JSON LD context [https://test.data.vlaanderen.be/context/vlaamse-codex.jsonld](https://test.data.vlaanderen.be/context/vlaamse-codex.jsonld) vind ik *zie_ook* niet terug. 

*zie_ook* staat echter wel hier: [https://test.data.vlaanderen.be/doc/applicatieprofiel/vlaamse-codex#Regelgevend%20Document%3Azie%20ook](https://test.data.vlaanderen.be/doc/applicatieprofiel/vlaamse-codex#Regelgevend%20Document%3Azie%20ook).

Ik snap ook niet helemaal waarom zowel *zie_ook* als *gezien_door* allebei verwijzen naar *related_to*. Inversen waarschijnlijk, maar ik kan nergens the ontology terugvinden waar dit alles beschreven wordt.

items.title: Subunits of an Organisation
items.body:
In a ANAC's dataset that we are mapping in the context of the BDTI pilot, there is data regarding subunits of the organisation that plays the role of buyer. 
It seems to me that in the OWL files there are no definitions to model this data.

There are two possible solutions, if we want to target this issue (at the time being that data on the subunits is not at all mapped in our pilot):

1) we declare somewhere the alignment (subClassOf) of our http://data.europa.eu/a4g/ontology#Organisation to org:Organization. In this case we could use org:Organization properties such as hasUnit and then use OrganizationalUnit (which is an Organization) to specify these subunits

2) we add in our namespace the modelling of subunits as it is done in org:organization and then we align all our classes and properties to org ontology.

Do you think it makes sense to model subunits of organisations in our domain?

items.title: Application profile - data properties namespace
items.body:
This is related to the Application Profile:

- When in the Conceptual Model there is a class of one namespace, with data properties of another namespace. See example:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15996178/100844296-f91d4980-347b-11eb-93d0-2e17d7133862.png)

- When producing the restrictions, shacl and owl files, these data properties are created in the class namespace, instead of their own namespace.

For example, reg2015:AdditionalInformation is created in http://data.europa.eu/a4g/extension/ontology#hasAdditionalInformation.

The object properties are created in the expected namespace.

In case you need an example, here you have the XMI: https://github.com/eprocurementontology/eprocurementontology/tree/v2.0.1/v2.0.1/03-Analysis%20and%20design/EA-Conceptual%20Model/Reg2015-ApplicationProfile/XMI

items.title: wrong European Institution
items.body:
Hi,
European Directives (~Laws) are adopted by the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union (aka The Council or the Council of Ministers), by codecision, or by the European Commission:
The European Accessibility Act was adopted thru the ordinary legislative procedure, thus not by the Commission.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union_legislative_procedure#Ordinary_legislative_procedure
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Accessibility_Act#References
**Directive (EU) 2019/882 of the European Parliament and of the Council** of 17 April 2019 on the accessibility requirements for products and services ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/dir/2019/882/oj
Instead of "**The European Commission adopted** the European Accessibility Act, requiring ATMs and […]"
in https://www.w3.org/WAI/business-case/#minimize-legal-risk it must be:
"The **European Parliament and the Council adopted** the European Accessibility Act, requiring ATMs and […]"
"The **European Union adopted** the European Accessibility Act, requiring ATMs and […]" is exact but less precise.
Thank you.

items.title: e-Link problems
items.body:
The CKEditor plugin uses non-existing e-Link templates for "spelling russian" and "spelling japanese". To reproduce the problem:

* Click detect concepts button
* click "get additional info"
* click "spelling russian" or "spelling chinese"

Please add the missing e-Link templates. I post the SQL queries to insert them directly to the database so they get the right IDs:

```
INSERT INTO `template` (`id`, `visibility`, `description`, `endpoint`, `label`, `query`, `owner_name`, `endpoint_type`, `creation_time`) VALUES 
(4517,1,NULL,'http://data.europa.eu/euodp/sparqlep','jrcnamesquery','PREFIX lemon: <http://www.lemon-model.net/lemon#> PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> CONSTRUCT {<@@@entity_uri@@@> lemon:writtenRep ?Rep } WHERE { { SELECT  ?Rep ?ref WHERE   {      ?variant rdf:type lemon:LexicalEntry .     ?variant lemon:language \'ja\' .     ?variant lemon:sense ?sense .     ?sense lemon:reference ?ref .     ?ref <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#sameAs> <@@@entity_uri@@@>.     ?variant lemon:canonicalForm ?form .     ?form lemon:writtenRep ?Rep .   }       } }','admin',0,1476199668967),
(4518,1,NULL,'http://data.europa.eu/euodp/sparqlep','jrcnamesquery','PREFIX lemon: <http://www.lemon-model.net/lemon#> PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> CONSTRUCT {<@@@entity_uri@@@> lemon:writtenRep ?Rep } WHERE { { SELECT  ?Rep ?ref WHERE   {      ?variant rdf:type lemon:LexicalEntry .     ?variant lemon:language \'ru\' .     ?variant lemon:sense ?sense .     ?sense lemon:reference ?ref .     ?ref <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#sameAs> <@@@entity_uri@@@>.     ?variant lemon:canonicalForm ?form .     ?form lemon:writtenRep ?Rep .   }       } }','admin',0,1476199820947)

```

items.title: Decide on authoritative source
items.body:
At the moment, the repository contains multiple serializations of the same ontology.
All but one can be removed, and instructions included on how to convert from one format to the other. Alternatively, these files could be included as assets attached to releases:
https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/creating-releases

items.title: Licence Controlled Vocabulary to be recommended for use with `dct:license`

labels.name: future-work
labels.description: this topic will be dealt in the future

items.body:
Issue #34 mentions EU Publications Office's [Licence Authority Table](https://op.europa.eu/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/licence) as a possible recommended vocabulary to be used for `dct:license` of `dcat:Distribution`.
A quick look at [ values for this property](https://data.europa.eu/sparql?default-graph-uri=&query=PREFIX+skos%3A+%3Chttp%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2004%2F02%2Fskos%2Fcore%23%3E%0D%0APREFIX+dct%3A+%3Chttp%3A%2F%2Fpurl.org%2Fdc%2Fterms%2F%3E%0D%0APREFIX+dcat%3A+%3Chttp%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2Fns%2Fdcat%23%3E%0D%0A%0D%0ASELECT++DISTINCT+%3Flicence%0D%0AWHERE+%7B+%3Fdist+a+dcat%3ADistribution+%3B%0D%0Adct%3Alicense+%3Flicence.%0D%0A%7D&format=text%2Fhtml&timeout=0&signal_void=on) (range `dct:LicenseDocument`) on data.europa.eu shows little homogeneity. To increase interoperability, we propose to:

-  indicate Licence NAL as a recommended vocabulary or 
- add a usage note (for example requesting Licence URI to be used whenever available (e.g. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

For reference see also https://github.com/w3c/dxwg/issues/114 and DCAT [License and Rights note](https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-2/#license-rights)  to increase interoperability.

items.body:

OSLO-Besluit https://data.vlaanderen.be/ns/besluit

**Omschrijving van het probleem:** 
Nood om te linken van een rechtsgrond naar het bestuursorgaan (bv. een administratie) die **onder delegatie** de rechtsgrond creëert.

**Omschrijving van een mogelijke oplossing:**

Range: Bestuursorgaan (http://data.vlaanderen.be/ns/besluit#Bestuursorgaan)

items.title: Shouldn't gist use a PURL for it's namespace IRI?
items.body:
Currently the namespace IRI for gist Core is: `https://ontologies.semanticarts.com/gist/`, but this IRI is problematic for two big reasons:
 - It tightly couples the ontology to the commercial company Semantic Arts, which might make non-USA governments, or non-USA-based cororations, wary of reusing it.
 - If Semantic Arts goes away (e.g., is bought out by another company, or it goes bust), then the domain name `https://semanticarts.com` may no longer exist or be resolvable, thereby preventing lookups. This could make any organization, USA-based or not, wary of having their data contain IRIs that may become unresolvable in future.

Instead it would be advisable (as is very common practice for ontologies genreally) to define the namespace IRI using a PURL service, such as `https://w3id.org`. (Other PURL services could be considered perhaps (but the only other 'major' PURL services that I'm aware of at the moment are European ones like the new `https://purl.eu`, or `https://data.europa.eu/`)).

If `https://w3id.org` were chosen, this would just require the registeration of 'gist' and a simple `.htaccess` file to redirect from a new gist namespace IRI (e.g., something like `https://w3id.org/gist/core/`) to the current location of the gist ontology, i.e., `https://ontologies.semanticarts.com/gist/`.

items.title: don't repeat term & ontology metadata in shapes
Suggestion for improvements
items.body:
Data is great, but it is hard to make sense of it. Some ideas to get a grip of what they mean...

Long lists are misleading and of little use. You want to compare only a small number of countries, for example

- corona switzerland sweden 

You might allow wildcards for countries you don't know the name of, e.g.

- corona %orea%

It is inconvenient and impractical to write country names. Use ISO codes instead or better alternatively

- corona be ch de se uk us

To give you an idea of how these numbers can be used to provide insight, here are some examples created with SQL. All results shown are based on https://data.europa.eu/euodp/de/data/dataset/covid-19-coronavirus-data from 2020-04-17.

A very important ratio is missing: cases and deaths per million or 10,000 inhabitants 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6130319/80657781-d9a4e500-8a84-11ea-87e8-39b6b5c0bd50.png)

- Here you see at first glance that countries with fewer inhabitants may be much more afflicted (deathsPer1mCapita) although the number of cases in other states (like US) is much higher as this result is ordered by that ratio.

It would be instructive to normalize this data with respect to a single country to get a feeling which country does better, e.g. with respect to de (having ratio 1.00)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6130319/80658107-81baae00-8a85-11ea-9695-32980204f614.png)

- You see here that Belgium has 9 times as many deaths per 1 million inhabitants than Germany. That number has more meaning than the ratio alone.

Next the ratio of cases and deaths is interesting. Well, we know that death numbers are not reliable (Corona may be interpreted as pneumonia) and case numbers are not reliable either (which people are tested, only those with severe symptoms or all infected?). But you get an idea nevertheless.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6130319/80662482-a2890080-8a91-11ea-92ea-ecbc748cdbe2.png)

- With the death-cases-ratio you see which country scores better (higher numbers are better here). At that time, Turkey did better than Germany and UK worse than Spain. Switzerland isn't much better than the US, and India follows directly behind.

Also, you see that for countries with a high population (especially India, China) the absolute numbers aren't helpful at all. 

Next it would be interesting to see these ratios develop over time. This would give a clue whether the measures of different countries are working.

items.title: Erasmus (student) exchanges in EU
items.body:
https://data.europa.eu/data/datasets?locale=en&catalog=eac&query=erasmus&page=1&sort=issued%2Bdesc,%20relevance%2Bdesc,%20title.en%2Basc

Analysis and plots at https://www.elconfidencial.com/mundo/europa/2021-12-28/erasmus-dos-velocidades-programa-ue-desigualdad_3348913/ (in Spanish)

From Data Is Plural:

> The European Union publishes [data on the movement of students, staff, and trainees](https://data.europa.eu/data/datasets?locale=en&catalog=eac&query=erasmus&page=1&sort=issued%2Bdesc,%20relevance%2Bdesc,%20title.en%2Basc) through its [Erasmus+](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erasmus_Programme) exchange program. The [most recent dataset](https://data.europa.eu/data/datasets/erasmus-mobility-statistics-2014-2019-v2?locale=en) covers academic years 2014–15 through 2019–20, detailing the international transfer of millions of participants. Each row lists a combination of variables and the number of participants who matched that description. The variables include the field of education, participant gender and nationality, duration of the exchange, sending and receiving cities and organizations, and more. As seen in: [Erasmus a dos velocidades](https://www.elconfidencial.com/mundo/europa/2021-12-28/erasmus-dos-velocidades-programa-ue-desigualdad_3348913/) (El Confidencial). [h/t [Rose Mintzer-Sweeney](https://blog.datawrapper.de/data-vis-dispatch-january-4-2022/)]

items.title: [BRUKERHISTORIE] Fjern "Beskrivelsen er konsis" som kriterie for metadatakvalitet
items.body:
Som: datatilbyder
Ønsker jeg å: kunne skrive lang beskrivelse uten å bli straffet i metadatakvalitet-måling
Slik at: jeg kan skrive inn dokumentasjon av datasett

------------------

Relatert til epos:

Lenke til design:
Lenke til løsningsarkitektur:

Forretningsverdi (Kritisk/Viktig/Mindre viktig/Kjekt å ha):

Eksempel på dette er smilefjes-data frå Mattilsynet:
https://data.norge.no/datasets/288aa74c-e3d3-492e-9ede-e71503b3bfd9
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3617256/148948516-c022873c-ab55-4ca5-9c83-80bdfac6c337.png)

I vurdering av metadatakvalitet så vert ein straffa for at beskrivelsen er for lang:
https://data.norge.no/organizations/985399077/datasets/288aa74c-e3d3-492e-9ede-e71503b3bfd9
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3617256/148948619-2b7b7914-72d5-4612-a487-8526fa5db5e1.png)

Det bør vere mogeleg å skrive lang beskrivelse, så lenge den er godt strukturert (e.g. viktigaste informasjon først, del-overskrifter), så bør det vere greitt. Nokre datatilbyderar har ikkje eigna stad å plassere dokumentasjon av datasettet, og då er det ein fordel å kunne nytte oppføringa i data.norge.no til dette der det er ønskjeleg.

Foreslår difor å droppe kriteriet heilt.

items.title: Looking for XML Schemas

labels.name: adjustment
labels.description: Suggest adjustments to existing features or properties

items.body:
Hi guys,
I am contacting you on behalf of the DE4A project.
Some of our guys used XSDs from EDCI that were supposed to be provided from you, including files like `edci_agent.xsd` or `edci_associationobject.xsd`.
Unfortunately I am unable to find those files in the repository anymore.
Can you please guide to the correct location?
Thanks, Philip

items.title: Icon Request: fa-leaflet
items.body:
A brand icon for [Leaflet](https://leafletjs.com/) maps.

### What can it be used for?

Showing that leaflet is being used.

### Example image (optional)

Logo: https://data.europa.eu/euodp/en/node/6577

### Icon request checklist

- [x] This is a single icon or matched pair (Ex: `lock` / `unlock`)
- [x] The title starts with "Icon request: " and is followed by the requested icon name (Ex: `Icon request: magical-unicorn`)
- [x] I have [searched for existing issues](https://github.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome/issues) and to the best of my knowledge this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have included at least one example image if it could be helpful (optional)
- [x] The request is for a concrete object (it's harder to make an icon to represent happiness, it's easier to make a smiley face. ☺)

items.title: Herbekijken specialisatie van 'heeftDeel' in de context van Vlaamse Codex
items.body:
**Model(len) waarop de issue van toepassing is:** 
https://data.vlaanderen.be/doc/applicatieprofiel/vlaamse-codex 

**Omschrijving van het probleem:** 
“is deel van” (de inverse van 'heeftDeel') verwijst al naar http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#is_part_of. Waarom “heeftDeel” in het AP nog steeds verwijst naar dcterms, in plaats van naar eli, weet ik niet. 

_dcterms:hasPart wordt ook niet meer gebruikt in het achterliggende transformatiescript bij Departement Kanselarij en Bestuur voor de LOD versie van de Codex en is volledig vervangen geweest door eli:has_part._ 
(@michieldk dit is dus enkel een change in het applicatieprofiel; geen change in het transformatiescript is nodig)

**Omschrijving van een mogelijke oplossing:** 
'heeftDeel' specialiseren van eli:has_part i.p.v. dcterms:hasPart.

items.title: Update base URI/URL
items.body:
Initial idea was to use EC data Publication Office to publish Energy Reference data with uri/url of http://data.europa.eu/energy or http://data.europa.eu/<xyz>/energy, but due to:
-  ENTSO-E not qualifying as EU institution
-  Publishing Office not wanting to take the responsibility for publishing
-  ENTSO-E and Publish Office not able to find anyone within DG energy to reguest base url on behalf on ENTSO-E
- Time pressure, where missing reference data would stop implementation of CGM realated services

ENTSO-E CIM EG decided on 2022-06-15 to use http://energy.referencedata.eu as the base URI and publish the data on ENTSO-E website

Task: change base URI from http://data.europa.eu/energy to http://energy.referencedata.eu
